catalyst.source: Herein, we have successfully fabricated all-solidstate Z-scheme ternary photocatalysts, consisting of two isolated photochemical systems of graphitic carbon nitride (g-C 3 N 4 ) and three-dimensional ordered macroporous carbon-coated TiO 2 (3DOM-TiO 2 C) combined with Pt nanoparticles as electron-transfer system.
catalyst.context: The artificial photosynthesis for visible-light-driven CO 2 reduction with H 2 O is promising to solve both energy and environmental issues simultaneously.Herein, we have successfully fabricated all-solidstate Z-scheme ternary photocatalysts, consisting of two isolated photochemical systems of graphitic carbon nitride (g-C 3 N 4 ) and three-dimensional ordered macroporous carbon-coated TiO 2 (3DOM-TiO 2 C) combined with Pt nanoparticles as electron-transfer system.Photonic crystal structure and carboncoated nanolayers of 3DOM-TiO 2 C support enhance visible light-harvesting efficiency.The vectorial photoelectron transferring of TiO 2 C ?Pt ?g-C 3 N 4 boosts the separation and surface enrichment efficiencies of photogenerated electrons and holes.All-solid-state Z-scheme ternary photocatalyst exhibits the outstanding yields of CH 4 (6.56 lmol h A1 , 0.1 g catalyst) and high-efficient quantum efficiency (5.67) during visible-light-driven conversion of CO 2 with H 2 O.The surface enrichment of electrons and CO 2 is the rate-determining step of selective CO 2 photoreduction.This study is expected to throw new light on the fabrication of high-efficient photocatalyst for CO 2 conversion to hydrocarbon.

(!420 nm).And the gas products were analyzed by gas chromatography (GC).The performances of the photocatalysts for visible-light-driven CO 2 reduction with H 2 O are shown in Fig. 7 and Table 1.The amount of catalysts used in the photoreaction is 0.1 g.Photocatalytically splitting H 2 O into H 2 is a competitive reaction in CO 2 reduction, and it's also the source of protons for CH 4 product 52.To comparison with the photocatalytic activities reported by other researchers, it is generally accepted that the commercial P25 was used as the reference sample due to its good photocatalytic performance and uniform crystal phase structure.Herein, commercial P25 purchased from Degussa (Co., Germany) was used to the reference catalyst, which composes of anatase (80) and rutile (20) with its average particle size of 21 nm.Compared to P25 and 3DOM-TiO 2 , 3DOM-TiO 2 C displays the higher CO 2 photoreduction catalytic activity, i.e., the formation rates of CO and CH 4 are 0.87 and 0.21 lmol h A1 , respectively.It indicates that the carbon-coated layers can enhance photocatalytic performance of TiO 2 catalyst.After introduce supported Pt NPs, the formation rates of H 2 and CH 4 products formation rate of CO (2.46 lmol h A1 ) and selectivity for CO 2 reduction (96.7), while its formation rate and selectivity of CH 4 product is the lowest.It may be related to the good adsorption and activation properties of pure g-C 3 N 4 for CO 2 reactant.And the binary synergetic effect of g-C 3 N 4 and 3DOM-TiO 2 C in g-C 3 N 4 /3DOM-TiO 2 C catalyst improves remarkably the formation rate of ), the theoretical formation rate of O 2 were calculated and shown in Table S3.The stoichiometric formation rate of O 2 was approximately equal to the practical formation rate of O 2 , indicating that light source.context: The artificial photosynthesis for visible-light-driven CO 2 reduction with H 2 O is promising to solve both energy and environmental issues simultaneously.Herein, we have successfully fabricated all-solidstate Z-scheme ternary photocatalysts, consisting of two isolated photochemical systems of graphitic carbon nitride (g-C 3 N 4 ) and three-dimensional ordered macroporous carbon-coated TiO 2 (3DOM-TiO 2 C) combined with Pt nanoparticles as electron-transfer system.Photonic crystal structure and carboncoated nanolayers of 3DOM-TiO 2 C support enhance visible light-harvesting efficiency.The vectorial photoelectron transferring of TiO 2 C ?Pt ?g-C 3 N 4 boosts the separation and surface enrichment efficiencies of photogenerated electrons and holes.All-solid-state Z-scheme ternary photocatalyst exhibits the outstanding yields of CH 4 (6.56 lmol h A1 , 0.1 g catalyst) and high-efficient quantum efficiency (5.67) during visible-light-driven conversion of CO 2 with H 2 O.The surface enrichment of electrons and CO 2 is the rate-determining step of selective CO 2 photoreduction.This study is expected to throw new light on the fabrication of high-efficient photocatalyst for CO 2 conversion to hydrocarbon.
